review: I love the convenience and responsiveness of this streaming dongle.  I love how it works with any of my smartphones or tablets.  But therein lies the rub, streaming from PC or laptop is a pain in the arse.  You can stream from the chrome browser, but not from any other program 'officially'.  Streaming from the browser also limits you to the formats that the browser supports, and doesn't enable transcoding like Plex does.  And yes, you can stream from Plex, but you still need to control it from a tablet or smartphone.  There is also spotty compatibility using the Chromecast app to cast your screen (works on Galaxy S5, but not on the LG tablet),My only other complaint is volume.  There seems to be a bug with certain apps that if you adjust the volume down using that app, Chromecast takes that new value as the maximum volume in another app.Things I'd like to see:Support for 5Ghz wifi band.Manage from PC/Laptop/Media Server - change settings, adjust audio balance, volume, and profile.Streaming support enabled to allow PC applications such as VLC or Media Player Classic to output to the Chromecast.

review: I bought one 2 months ago and am incredibly dissatisfied with this product. I typically use this to watch media (netflix, hulu, hbogo, etc) and the chromechast 1) takes forever to load a video 2) completely sucks at controlling the video once it is playing and 3) makes you recast every single time. I much prefer my amazon fire stick and have bought a second one for my other tv. If you are buying this to watch streaming shoes AVOID IT.
